title: Ulama
summary: In Islam, the ulama (/ˈuːləˌmɑː/; Arabic: علماء‎ ʿUlamāʾ, singular عالِم ʿĀlim, "scholar", literally "the learned ones",[1] also spelled ulema; feminine: alimah [singular] and aalimath [plural])[2] are the guardians, transmitters, and interpreters of religious knowledge in Islam, including Islamic doctrine and law.[2]
